title: The Speed of Light
content: Light travels at approximately 299,792 kilometers per second in a vacuum, making it the fastest thing in the universe.

title: Ancient Egypt's Great Pyramid
content: The Great Pyramid of Giza was the tallest man-made structure in the world for over 3,800 years until the completion of Lincoln Cathedral in 1311.

title: Amazing Human Body
content: The human body contains enough carbon to make around 900 pencils.

title: Ocean Depths
content: The Mariana Trench is the deepest known point on Earth, reaching a depth of approximately 11,034 meters (36,201 feet).

title: Computer Games
content: The first computer game was created in 1961 called SpaceWar and ran on a computer the size of a car.

title: Cats
content: Cats sleep around 12-16 hours per day spending about 2/3 of their lives sleeping.

title: Stock Exchange
content: The first stock exchange was established in Amsterdam in 1602.
